CatDescriptText: Mr. Theodore Patillo, nursing service attendant at the Veterans Administration Hospital, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "It is my opinion that the standards should not be lowered. Once you lower the standards, you are encouraging the slow learner to continue to be a slow learner and to have little or no incentive.  A good idea would be to have some special classes and in this way bring the slow learners up to the standard of the other pupils."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Theodore Patillo wearing light colored flecked coat, diamond patterned tie, and light colored hat with dark band, holding paper bag and standing on sidewalk
